review_text:
The beaches in Portugal are the cleanest we have ever been to! This country cares about the environment and actually implements measures that work!
Supertubos is gorgeous! Great little beach cafe at far end
Súpertubos beach bar was a great little place to wait for my husband while he surfed! Really good (and cheap) sangria and the food was decent!
Boring if the surf is poor, fantastic when the surf is good.  Easy parking, a few good cafes, penty of walking opportunities
Big waves. Kids were afraid of them but nobody else was on the beach. We were awaiting just some surfers but even they were not there.

Even if you're not surfing the beaches in Peniche are amazing. The ocean is spectacular with lively waves, beautiful colours and the softest sand. We walked almost 20km in one day along the beach, which we much preferred to the town. Highly recommend visiting and wearing shorts or swimwear.

review_title: The beach is great. The staff in the cafe could do with a little less attitude
review_text: It was  a Thursday afternoon about 3 pm; the place was half-full mostly people just having a beer in the sun. I ordered a €12 hamburger. I wasn't told there would be a protracted delay. After about 20 minutes I politely asked how long it would be. I got put back in my box very quickly "We will bring it to you when it is ready" Sub-text - "sit down and behave or else". No "sorry for the delay sir". When it arrived ten minutes later it wasn't worth the wait.
Went by here with my family and daughter and son in law are surfers.  Being a beach that holds a world tournament we had to see it.  Pretty, clean and calm during the summer.

review_title: Beautiful beach and perfect for surfing
review_text: This beach area has a lot to offer, maybe particularly for surfers. Surf some waves and hit up some delicious local restaurants after a long day at the beach.
This beach is both beautiful and exciting. Good waves, good resraturants. Nice people. Clean sand and pro. guards!

review_title: Great for surf and also Amazing Sunset view!!!
review_text: Beautiful beach, great for surfer and also the world surf championship but particularly the amazing sunset!
the perfect moment to stay there is before sunset, banana bar is a perfect relaxed beach bar where you can enjoy sunset and surfing people
Beautiful long beach to get lost  on it. Great for surfing ( when there are waves- more in autumn and winter) and great for sunbathing. Cool bar with tasty foods

review_title: Huge, beautiful beach, with nice Supertubos beach bar
review_text: Huge, beautiful beach, with nice Supertubos beach bar. Best is to hit the beach close to the Supertubis Beach Bar, a little further away from the village and harbour. You can park at the Supertubos beach club. Close to the harbour, it could be smelly from time to time due to the fish factory.

Supertubos beach is a fabulous long surfing beach which had the perfect waves breaking & suitable for most levels of surfing or body surfing. We loved this stretch of beaches in Portugal far better than the Agaves.
The beach is very beautiful and you can do endless walks along the water side. It's amazing to watch the sunset at supertubos!

review_title: Cool Beach, Good Waves, Great Cafe
review_text:
Aptly named, this beach throws up great surfing and bodyboarding, even in the middle of August. Easy to park and, if you're prepared to walk 100 yards, you get the place almost to yourself.

Our boys ( 12 and 15) spent hours bodyboarding within the guarded section of the beach but it offers miles of space - you can walk south as far as the end of the peninsula if you want.

The cafe is great too - reminded me of the Algarve 30 years ago, Good simple food and drinks, cool staff and ridiculously reasonable

A great place to soak up the sun

This beach is beautiful to look at and not as busy as neighbouring Baleal but it's not as child friendly owing to the breaking waves and obvious strong current. Having said that we took a 5 year old and a 7 year old and they had great fun splashing in the surf but I wouldn't want them to go out too far here. There's a surf school and a great beach cafe.

Bonita playa! A great beach!
Olas fabulosas!! Fabulous waves!! Even though it smells of fish from the nearby fish farms!

review_title: Heavy beach break with fun but tricky waves
review_text: I am an intermediate surfer and catch most waves easily, Supertubos is one of the more tricky ones I surfed so far. The swell comes from deeper sections of the ocean and builds up fast and steep just of the beach. However if it is not too big, the wave is great fun to ride even for my level. And of course it has the worldcup. This is a surfers beach and I would not recommend swimming here as the currents can be very strong. A friend got pulled in the rip current once - she was only rescued by the lifeguards.

So this is an amazing wave. almost doesn't matter the size this place is drop to straight barrels. Very local dominated with body boarders. but respect others and you will get a wave

This is for experience surfers only! anyone learning or not a very experienced surfer is bound to get hurt, either from the waves or from the locals

review_title: Lovely beach with stunning sand dunes
review_text:
We visited here on a lovely, scorching hot day. My wife and daughter went for a walk down by the sea, where it was cooler.
Whilst me and my son went off in the sand dunes, where he enjoyed rolling around in the sand, and running up and down the dunes.
This activity didn't last too long though, lol

review_title: You can just dream with get a tube there...
review_text: I've been visiting this place since 2009 and I have been in diferent season but the truth is that when is big is a showroom where the experienced surfers give their best to ride one of the most powerfull waves I've surf ever in my life... when it is small yu can have fun and also surfers of midium level can get a wave... you have to always respect the local sufers but if you show respect you will have fun in and out of the water. People who stay in the sand also can have a good time in sunny days...

Plenty of space and plenty of surf. A fantastically clean beach with just enough waves for a decent surf, without being to intimidating for a swim. Appeared to be mostly locals, lots of bohemian and surf types hanging out here. Lovely dunes for shelter and a long expanse of uncluttered golden sand. One of my favourite beaches along the silvercoast so far.

review_title: Excellent beach for surfers and non-surfers alike
review_text:
This beach has it all. The surf is top notch. There's tons of space on the sand to set up, but bring your own umbrella as they don't rent any out. It's DOG FRIENDLY, which is wonderful if you're looking for a place to take your fury friend. For those of you who don't have dog, don't worry, the dogs can't swim in the designated swim area.

I would suggest visiting the Banana Beach Bar for food and drinks. They're snacks are delicious and the vibe is laid-back and fun. They're not on tripadvisor so you'll have to walk around to find them. It's worth it though.

Might not be the best wave in the world but it's definitely the best in Europe!
Even if you don't surf, just pop by and whatch the perfection of those waves.

Went there this last saturday 28/01/2012 and it was absolutelly classic.... Got four beautifull barrels ... and not to crowded .... it was great !!!!

Classic
the perfect moment to stay there is before sunset, banana bar is a perfect relaxed beach bar where you can enjoy sunset and surfing people
Beautiful long beach to get lost  on it. Great for surfing ( when there are waves- more in autumn and winter) and great for sunbathing. Cool bar with tasty foods

review_title: Excellent beach for surfers and non-surfers alike
review_text:
This beach has it all. The surf is top notch. There's tons of space on the sand to set up, but bring your own umbrella as they don't rent any out. It's DOG FRIENDLY, which is wonderful if you're looking for a place to take your fury friend. For those of you who don't have dog, don't worry, the dogs can't swim in the designated swim area.

I would suggest visiting the Banana Beach Bar for food and drinks. They're snacks are delicious and the vibe is laid-back and fun. They're not on tripadvisor so you'll have to walk around to find them. It's worth it though.

Might not be the best wave in the world but it's definitely the best in Europe!
Even if you don't surf, just pop by and whatch the perfection of those waves.
